oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Patriotic societies; Women; Group portraits; Memorial photographs; Women; Patriotic societies
United Daughters of the Confederacy - Tennessee Division
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: United Daughters of the Confederacy group portrait. "Mrs. Kate L. Hickman" is written on the back of the photograph with the date and location.

Kate Litton Hickman was the daughter of Isaac and Lucinda (Tyree) Litton of Franklin, Tennessee. She was married to John P. Hickman. She was a prominent member of the United Daughters of the Confederacy (U.D.C.) and held many offices including: Secretary; Recording Secretary; President General and chapter President. In 1903, she organized a U.D.C. chapter under her name in East Nashville.
